title: Houston area keeps disconnecting
body: Yesterday when I was playing with some friends when one of my friends and I simultaneously disconnected. None of our other friends disconnected so we thought it was an isolated incident since it only happened one time. Today, however, the same friend and I simultaneously disconnected again twice in a row and later a third friend from the same area disconnected as well in another game. It's been less than an hour and we've disconnected three or four times. Our friend from San Diego wasn't affected at all so I know it has to do with our local area. What is happening and is there something that can be done?

replies.body:
Would you mind running a traceroute for me really quick so I can get a clear picture of how your connection looks coming to our servers? If this is affecting everyone around the Houston area I'd like to try and figure out where it's stemming from!

Grab [WinMTR](http://winmtr.net/winmtr-v0-92-now-available/) and run that trace to 104.160.131.1 for a good 5-10 min and post the results here!


EDIT: Same goes for anyone else in the comment section. Feel free to post your results in a comment and I'll be looking through these. I may not respond to everyone but this will help us gather some data fam!

I'm seeing an awful lot of packet loss happening right after these lightspeed nodes. 

> |107-209-160-1.lightspeed.hstntx.sbcglobal.net - 0 | 303 | 303 | 1 | 9 | 96 | 1 |
> | 71.149.23.126 - 50 | 102 | 51 | 1 | 2 | 4 | 2 |
> | 71.144.129.96 - 4 | 267 | 258 | 2 | 2 | 17 | 2 |

I'm thinking there might be something broken or otherwise not working correctly on that specific node, but it's a bit over this poro's head to say for sure.

If anyone is seeing traces like this, *please* submit them to our techs in a [**ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) to help us gather this data and see if there's any way we could help on our end, or if this is something we will have to wait for AT&T to sort out!

Mmmmm okay this line....

> | 71.144.129.88 - 73 | 141 | 39 | 0 | 11 | 73 | 6 |

....is showing about 73% packet loss, which will really cause a lot of problems. It could be an improperly working node along the route your ISP is sending your signal, or it could just be general ISP issues. 

Do you mind letting me know what ISP you're using?
I am having the same issue but in San Antonio. I called AT&T and my internet is fine. My game won't load following champ select and I get an error message saying I cannot connect with Servers.

That sounds like a slightly different issue involving firewalls imo. Double check those for me quickly, either disable or add exceptions with [**these steps**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664#mq3), and I'd also check the antivirus steps on that page as well. 

If that doesn't work, go ahead and drop me a traceroute here as well!
I have AT&T
Same.

> [{quoted}](name=Broporo,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=PbH1Ke9r,comment-id=000600000000,timestamp=2018-01-25T01:15:50.752+0000)
>
> Mmmmm okay this line....
> 
> ....is showing about 73% packet loss, which will really cause a lot of problems. It could be an improperly working node along the route your ISP is sending your signal, or it could just be general ISP issues. 
> 
> Do you mind letting me know what ISP you're using?

I work for AT&T and can monitor networks more closely, I'm getting similar issues and there's no issues on our end coming through.. at least for me.

Regardless of ISP, that traceroute is showing major packet loss for some reason which is very likely the source of all their lag problems. Also, packet loss may not affect 100% of an ISP's customer base either, it's all to do with how your connection is being routed to us.

If you're having any issues as well, feel free to shoot us that trace to take a look!
Does this mean there will be a solution in the near future?
I also live in the houston area and am unable to connect to games, been happening since the patch. Have tried 3 times now, all the times i receive an unable to connect error message

> [{quoted}](name=Bradonious,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=PbH1Ke9r,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2018-01-24T19:40:20.005+0000)
>
> I also live in the houston area and am unable to connect to games, been happening since the patch. Have tried 3 times now, all the times i receive an unable to connect error message

Same! please help.
The same thing happened to me too in San Antonio last night, and also right now.

This is happening to me too. Never had issues before however just now I've had issues with two straight games.

Tried to check my network logs and didn't even generate a log.

Ive also had the same problems while streaming. Attempting to reconnect would pop up randomly and i know its not my internet because there would be no lag in my voice or loading screen. Sometime the dc would last a couple minutes to 15 minutes at a time. I live in the Houston area as well, its refreshing to see that this problem is not just me
Same thing is happening to me, I live in south Houston. Just ate a leaver loss in rank =/. Tried arams just now and I connected for about 15 seconds then dc again.

This happened to me. I'm in my ranked match (still trying to reconnect because i thought restarting would help). If Arlington is part of the Houston area then I'm affected too. Welp. GG lp and probably a penalty :(

Edit: game finished and apparently I got punished for AFK and got LP loss. seriously?
This happened to me last night as well from the San Antonio area
Same shit for me, constant 250-300 ping out of nowhere. I work for my ISP and there are no issues on my end.
